meanings.definition: A group or collection of things, typically of the same type
meanings.sent1: At the store, the bunchers of bananas caught my eye.
meanings.sent2: The bunchers of flowers at the market were vibrant and beautiful.
meanings.sent3: The bunchers of keys on his keychain made a jingling sound as he walked.
meanings.sent4: Her room was a bunchers of colorful toys scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The bunchers of balloons filled the room with a festive atmosphere.

meanings.definition: People who gather or collect items in large quantities
meanings.sent1: The bunchers of stamps in his collection were from all over the world.
meanings.sent2: The bunchers of recyclables worked diligently to clean up the park.
meanings.sent3: The bunchers of seashells on the beach were excited to show off their finds.
meanings.sent4: She was known as one of the best bunchers of rare books in the city.
meanings.sent5: The bunchers of antiques at the auction were eager to bid on unique items.
